newsitem.title: USA: Read-Rite to defend against class action.
newsitem.headline: Read-Rite to defend against class action.

text.p: The general counsel for Read-Rite Corp said late on Thursday that the firm will defend itself vigorously against a class action suit filed against it.
"Our view is we have meritorious defenses with respect to all the suits that have been filed," said Rex Jackson, Read-Rite vice president and general counsel.

Earlier, two law firms said they had begun a class action in U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California on behalf of buyers of Read-Rite Corp securities from March 2, 1996, to June 19, 1996.

A joint statement from the law firms of Berger & Montague PC and Gold Bennett & Cera LLP said the action alleges Read-Rite and two of its officers and directors violated federal securities laws by issuing false and misleading statements and omitting material facts about the company's products, operations and financial performance.
Jackson said the class period for the suit overlaps the class period of a suit filed earlier this year in federal court.
"We are defending these suits vigorously and will continue to do so," Jackson said.
